isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - GENERAL INFORMATION - 1992-1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - DATA LINK CONNECTOR

svcproc.title: DATA LINK CONNECTOR
svcproc.para: The data link is a data communications system that transfers electronic information between various components on and off the vehicle.
On 9200/9300/9400 Series vehicles, the data link connector allows interfacing between on-board electronics and other electronic instruments.

The outline and pinout of the data link connector are shown in Figure 3. The connector has two pins, one labeled (+) and one labeled (-). The signal on these wires is very different from standard truck-type electrical signals. Truck signals usually are on or off and either 12 volts DC or zero volts DC. The data link connector wires, (+) and (-), carry a pulsed signal which may or may not be detected with voltmeter. Refer to the specific chapter for pin/circuit information.
An ohmmeter can be used to check wires in the engine control circuits, but specific diagnostic equipment must be used to check for proper system operation and diagnostics.
